aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Cost Reduction Strategy
Amazon seeks to reduce variable costs per unit.
Amazon works to leverage fixed costs.
Amazon's variable costs include product costs.
Amazon's variable costs include content costs.
Amazon's variable costs include payment processing costs.
Amazon's variable costs include transaction costs.
Amazon's variable costs include picking costs.
Amazon's variable costs include packaging costs.
Amazon's variable costs include preparing orders for shipment.
Amazon's variable costs include transportation costs.
Amazon's variable costs include customer service support costs.
Amazon's variable costs include costs necessary to run Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Amazon's variable costs include a portion of marketing costs.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs necessary to build technology infrastructure.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs necessary to run technology infrastructure.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to build online stores.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to enhance online stores.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to add features to online stores.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to build web services.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to enhance web services.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to add features to web services.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to build electronic devices.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to enhance electronic devices.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to add features to electronic devices.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to build digital offerings.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to enhance digital offerings.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to add features to digital offerings.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to build fulfillment network.
Amazon's fixed costs include costs to optimize fulfillment network.
Variable costs generally change directly with sales volume.
Fixed costs generally depend on timing of capacity needs.
Fixed costs generally depend on geographic expansion.
Fixed costs generally depend on category expansion.
Fixed costs generally depend on other factors.
Amazon seeks to increase direct sourcing to decrease variable costs on a per unit basis.
Amazon seeks to increase discounts from suppliers to decrease variable costs on a per unit basis.
Amazon seeks to reduce defects in processes to decrease variable costs on a per unit basis.
Amazon aims to lower prices for customers by decreasing variable costs on a per unit basis.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/

text: We seek to reduce our variable costs per unit and work to leverage our fixed costs. Our variable costs include product and content costs, payment processing and related transaction costs, picking, packaging, and preparing orders for shipment, transportation, customer service support, costs necessary to run AWS, and a portion of our marketing costs. Our fixed costs include the costs necessary to build and run our technology infrastructure; to build, enhance, and add features to our online stores, web services, electronic devices, and digital offerings; and to build and optimize our fulfillment network. Variable costs generally change directly with sales volume, while fixed costs generally are dependent on the timing of capacity needs, geographic expansion, category expansion, and other factors. To decrease our variable costs on a per unit basis and enable us to lower prices for customers, we seek to increase our direct sourcing, increase discounts from suppliers, and reduce defects in our processes.
